attributes.action: review teachers' pay so that it rises in line with inflation
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background:
Teachers' pay rise next year is, in fact, a pay cut because the rate of inflation has increased.  
The pay rise is 2.5% next year, compared to inflation which is running near 5%.  The Government promised to review teachers' pay if inflation went higher than 3.5%.  The Government has since broken this promise and has refused to review teachers' pay.

government_responses.details:
